alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Somerset (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 07 at 4:52PM EDT until July 07 at 7:30PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: The National Weather Service in Gray has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southern Somerset County in west central Maine... Northeastern Franklin County in western Maine... * Until 730 PM EDT. * At 452 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Kingfield, Bingham, Athens, Embden, Brighton Plantation, Caratunk Plantation, Moscow, Concord, Pleasant Ridge Plantation and Mayfield. This includes the following Rec locations... Moxie Bald Mountain. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
